weka.knowledgeflow.steps

Class MLlibClassifierEvaluationSparkJob

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.knowledgeflow.steps.BaseStep
      • weka.knowledgeflow.steps.MLlibClassifierEvaluationSparkJob
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, BaseStepExtender, Step

    @KFStep(name="MLLibClassifierEvaluationSparkJob",
        category="Spark",
        toolTipText="builds and evaluates an MLlib classifier/regressor via cross-validation in Spark",
        iconPath="weka/gui/knowledgeflow/icons/WekaClassifierEvaluationSparkJob.gif")
public class MLlibClassifierEvaluationSparkJob
extends BaseStep
    A Knowledge Flow step for the MLlib classifier evaluation Spark job
    Version:
    $Revision: $
    Author:
    Mark Hall (mhall{[at]}pentaho{[dot]}com)

      • getSampleFractionForAUC

        public java.lang.String getSampleFractionForAUC()
        Get the percentage of predictions to retain (via uniform random sampling) for computing AUC and AUPRC. If not specified, then no predictions are retained and these metrics are not computed.
        Returns:
        the fraction (between 0 and 1) of all predictions to retain for computing AUC/AUPRC.

      • setSampleFractionForAUC

        @OptionMetadata(displayName="Sampling fraction for computing AUC",
                description="The percentage of all predictions (randomly sampled) to retain for computing AUC and AUPRC. If not specified, then these metrics are notcomputed and no predictions are kept. Use this option to keep the number of predictions retained under control when computing AUC/PRC.",
                displayOrder=2)
public void setSampleFractionForAUC(java.lang.String f)
        Set the percentage of predictions to retain (via uniform random sampling) for computing AUC and AUPRC. If not specified, then no predictions are retained and these metrics are not computed.
        Parameters:
        f - the fraction (between 0 and 1) of all predictions to retain for computing AUC/AUPRC.

      • setEvaluateOnTestSetIfPresent

        @OptionMetadata(displayName="Evaluate on separate test set if present",
                description="Evaluate on a separate test dataset (if present) rather than perform cross-validation on the training data.",
                displayOrder=3)
public void setEvaluateOnTestSetIfPresent(boolean evaluateOnTestSetIfPresent)
        Set whether to evaluate on a test set (if present in the dataset manager). Knowledge Flow mode only
        Parameters:
        evaluateOnTestSetIfPresent - true to evaluate on a test set if available

      • getEvaluateOnTestSetIfPresent

        public boolean getEvaluateOnTestSetIfPresent()
        Get whether to evaluate on a test set (if present in the dataset manager). Knowledge Flow mode only
        Returns:
        true to evaluate on a test set if available
